snippet: Two former owners of Freedom Industries pleaded guilty on Monday to environmental violations stemming from last year’s Charleston chemical spill.
abstract: William Tis and Charles Herzing, two former owners of Freedom Industries, plead guilty to unlawful-discharge violations in connection with 2013 chemical spill in Charleston, SC, that resulted in cutoff of tap water for hundreds of thousands of residents.
lead_paragraph: Two former owners of Freedom Industries pleaded guilty on Monday to environmental violations stemming from last year’s Charleston chemical spill.

headline.main: West Virginia: 2 Plead Guilty in River Pollution
headline.print_headline: West Virginia: 2 Plead Guilty in River Pollution
